channel.title: @tobyblog’s Tobyblog - Covers
channel.description: All entries in Covers on Tobyblog
channel.item:
Cover Battle — The Great Pumpkin Waltz http://192.168.0.9/posts/cover-battle--the-great-pumpkin-waltz/ Tue, 08 Sep 2015 11:10:00 +0000 (Toby Marks) http://192.168.0.9/posts/cover-battle--the-great-pumpkin-waltz/

We are officially in the “-BER months” now, a time of year that for my generation is indelibly stamped by the melancholy Peanuts cartoon soundtracks of Vince Guiraldi and his trio. Though the nostalgic quality of these tracks reaches fever pitch around Christmastime, we begin our seasonal contemplation with this wistful little tune, quickly supplanted in the Guiraldi lineup, but never quite forgotten. It remains one of my favorites, but I’ll only listen to it from the start of September through Halloween.

I am partial to YouTube covers, so here are some covers of The Great Pumpkin Waltz by The Vince Guiraldi Trio. I’m breaking precedent here by allowing in some truly exceptional professional covers simply because I love the piece so much, and those are the ones I use in my personal playlist.

Enjoy. Show these guys some support by liking and/or subscribing to their stuff. And let me know which is your favorite!

Cover Battle — Love Songs http://192.168.0.9/posts/cover-battle-love-songs/ Thu, 14 Aug 2014 21:48:00 +0000 (Toby Marks) http://192.168.0.9/posts/cover-battle-love-songs/

It’s time once again for one of my patented YouTube cover battles, and in typical fashion you pick the winner. Tonight’s theme is one of my favorite for YouTube covers — LOVE SONGS. I have my personal favorite, of course, but I won’t spoil it for you. Enjoy, and leave a comment to vote for the winner.

The first track is by Goga, a local (Dallas) wedding singer and one-man-band act. This was actually filmed at a performance in downtown Dallas in 2008. Go Goga!



Next up is YouTube artist Rob Preston singing Billy Joel’s Just The Way You Are. Barry White did do a nice cover of this song, but I still prefer Joel’s version. But Preston’s cover is not bad, and songs seem more soulful when sung alone in your office/living room.



Last we have professional musician Jude Perl singing an offbeat rendition of Marvin Gaye’s classic. A good attempt at a viral hit? You be the judge.

Cover Battle — Red Rubber Ball http://192.168.0.9/posts/cover-battle--red-rubber-ball/ Thu, 24 Jul 2014 21:58:00 +0000 (Toby Marks) http://192.168.0.9/posts/cover-battle--red-rubber-ball/

I woke up this morning with this song stuck in my head, thinking about my dad and the good progress he’s making recovering from a triple bypass operation.
I probably thought of it because I noticed it was in the repertoire of local musician Bruce Wilder, who graced us at the coffee shop one evening with his guitar.


Here are my three favorite YouTube covers of this 1966 song by Paul Simon and Bruce Woodley. Vote for your favorite!
#1. The Snapsons (My vote for best ensemble act)

#2. hopeonatenspeed (My vote for best ukelele)

#3. Bradlands (Another ukelele act, but best actual singing)
